Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: A 6-month coaching program called FASTLEAD, run by HFL (Harbour Future Leaders) aims to build our leaders' capabilities by building essential skills, knowledge and the confidence to transition from individual contributors to influential business leaders.
column20: Leadership Development, Coaching Program, Transition Skills

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: NEXTDC's educational assistance program is in place to assist employees who wish to undertake a qualification or course to further their professional development. In FY23, we saw several employees take up this opportunity and begin their journey towards diplomas and graduate diplomas, bachelor's degrees, and MBAs.
column20: Educational Assistance, Professional Development, Qualification Support

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The Key Talent Initiative (KTI) has continued for the third year and seeks to identify and develop high-potential talent across the business. The program identifies, trains and advances high-performing team members to ensure a sustainable individual contributor and leadership pipeline. The KTI includes tailored coaching on development plans, career mentoring with the Executive team and Personal Profile Analysis to provide insights into strengths, weaknesses and development opportunities.
column20: Talent Development, High-Potential Program, Leadership Pipeline

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column7: Board gender proportions: 38% female and 62% male. Group workforce gender proportions: 34% female and 65.5% male.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: To address the broader imbalance, NEXTDC continues to promote diversity, dismantle barriers to inclusion and promote equity for all team members. One of the ways we seek to achieve this is through NEXTPOLL, our annual engagement survey. The survey conducted in July 2022 found that 81% of our employees rated our efforts on diversity and inclusion as 'favourable' or better, identifying the company as an inclusive and respectful workplace.
column20: Diversity Promotion, Inclusion Efforts, Equity Measures

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Throughout FY23, we have implemented unconscious bias training programs to educate employees, People Managers, and Senior Management about bias, its impact on decision-making, and mitigation strategies. These programs include workshops, online modules, or interactive discussions to raise awareness and foster a more inclusive mindset. We encourage our leaders to model inclusive behaviours, challenge assumptions, and promote an environment where all voices are valued and heard.
column20: Unconscious Bias Training, Inclusive Mindset, Bias Mitigation

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column13: NEXTDC conducts its business consistent with practises outlined by the United Nations Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights. NEXTDC's supplier assurance program explicitly addresses compliance with the Modern Slavery Act 2018 (Cth.), which requires us to report on and take action on any risks of modern slavery identified in our operations and supply chains.
column20: Human Rights Compliance, Modern Slavery Act, Supplier Assurance

column13: NEXTDC's Workplace Giving Program allows employees to donate directly from their pre-tax salary to The Smith Family, Cancer Council, Beyond Blue, Red Cross, UN Women or SolarBuddy. To embed the ethos of giving back yet further, NEXTDC matches employee contributions, dollar for dollar.
column20: Workplace Giving Program, Charitable Donations, Employee Matching

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column8: West Arnhem Land Fire Abatement (WALFA) Project
column13: Arnhem Land in the Northern Territory is prone to extreme, devastating wildfires that affect the landscape, people, plants and animals. These projects are owned exclusively by Aboriginal people with custodial responsibility for those parts of Arnhem Land under active bushfire management. Local rangers conduct controlled burns early in the dry season to reduce fuel on the ground and establish a mosaic of natural firebreaks, preventing bigger, hotter and uncontrolled wildfires later in the season.
column20: Bushfire Management, Indigenous Projects, Environmental Conservation

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: We have systems in place to ensure the integrity of the Code is maintained. Where appropriate, suppliers are subject to a competitive selection process that evaluates their experience, sustainability practices, qualifications, depth of quality assurance, demonstrable financial viability, and comprehensive insurance coverage.
column20: Supplier Selection Process, Sustainability Evaluation, Quality Assurance

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: As part of our third-party risk management process, our contractors must submit an Environmental Management Plan to advise NEXTDC on minimising their environmental impact, where applicable. The effectiveness of environmental controls is included in the vetting and review process of new and existing suppliers. These are tracked and monitored via our internal assurance process.
column20: Environmental Management Plan, Third-Party Risk Management, Sustainability Vetting

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: Quarterly Business Reviews (QBR) with our key suppliers are used to discuss our expectations and assess compliance with sustainability requirements and best practices. In FY23, we established the supplier audit process. The comprehensive audit will prioritise tier 1 suppliers and will commence in Q1FY24.
column20: Supplier Compliance, Sustainability Audit, Best Practice Review

column13: Internal data management procedures, such as the Data Retention Policy, Incident Management Procedure Cyber Security Incident Response Plan, Data Breach Notification Process and the IT Disaster Recovery Plan, support how we manage, protect and secure data integrity and respond to a security or privacy breach. These procedures are designed to comply with all relevant legislation. All NEXTDC team members, contractors, and consultants must undergo annual mandatory privacy management and information security awareness training.
column20: Data Management Procedures, Security Protocols, Compliance

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Our Cybersecurity framework enables us to manage cybersecurity-related risk. We also perform third-party audits to benchmark relevance and effectiveness. We maintain internal cybersecurity and information security policies available to all employees.
column20: Cybersecurity Framework, Risk Management, Third-Party Audits

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: NEXTDC's security risk management program safeguards our assets, people, property, information, and, most importantly, our customers' equipment, security, and operational environments. NEXTDC seeks to provide customers with the highest standards of security using a risk-based, intelligence-driven program. The protection of NEXTDC data centres is enhanced using successive layers of security through a unified physical, electronic and personnel security platform.
column20: Security Risk Management, Asset Protection, Intelligence-Driven Program
